channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024060364
item.description:
Report E-2024060364

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: CAMERON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024 at 1039 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Cameron, Missouri regarding the release of MULTI-PURPOSE MB COLD ADHESIVE. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 1 ounce of MULTI-PURPOSE MB COLD ADHESIVE from (3) 4.75-gallon pails due to being crushed. The release was caused by the load strap crushing the pails and was contained to the side of the pails only. Contractors were able to collect the damaged pails and place them into a plastic drum without complication. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061123
item.description:
Report X-2024061123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY A SORTER IN THE HUB SECONDARY. THE SORTER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR. A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 3 MINUTES DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT ONE OF THE LIDS ON ONE OF THE INNER ONE GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON.

item.title: Report X-2024060682
item.description:
Report X-2024060682

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: COLUMBIA
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fred Harris City Driver at 104 called safety to report a tote that he unloaded off trailer 556374 was leaking on the trailer floor and on the dock floor in front of bay 14. Fred stated he noticed it leaking then he removed the tote from the trailer and set it on the dock floor. Safety asked if he kn ew how the tote was damaged, Fred stated he did not know and that it could have been the forklift forks while unloading the tote but was not sure. Fred stated the tote was dripping from underneath the tote and was leaking on the dock. Fred stated the tote was not full and does not look like it leake d very much in the trailer but looks like some has dried up on the trailer floor.

item.title: Report X-2024060561
item.description:
Report X-2024060561

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations. 1 fiberboard box containing 4- 3.785 Liter plastic bottles of Up-Cyde Pro 2.0EC (insecticide). One of the bottles leaked, but it is unknown if it was punctured or a loose top due to the strong odor it was emitting. The spill clean up employee was suited in PPE with his respirator. The package and all of its contents were immediately placed in a salvage drum. Several employees (4) complained of burning throat, light headedness. One out of the 4 also complained of respiratory issues and went to the minor med/clinic the following day but was NOT hospitalized. The package is being held for FAA Investigation.

PACKAGE CONTAINED SWIMWAY PH MINUS, SWIMWAY CONDITIONER, AND ADDITIONAL INTERIOR PACKAGE OF AQUA SMARTE PLUS POOL AWAKE PRODUCTS WITH LIMITED QUANTITY LABEL PRINTED ON CARTON. CORROSIVE SOLID, ACIDIC, INORGANIC, NOS / TOXIC LIQUIDS, ORGANIC, NOS. DAMAGE INSPECTION; NON REGULATED PRODUCT LEAKED; NO LEAK TO HAZARDOUS PRODUCTS.

item.title: Report E-2024060063
item.description:
Report E-2024060063

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail that was damaged during transit due to falling freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris and damaged pail into one (1) 8-gallon metal drum The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060077
item.description:
Report E-2024060077

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the spent cleanup debris and damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
